meanings.definition: Capable of being discounted or reduced in price.
meanings.sent1: The store offered a discountable price on the new laptop.
meanings.sent2: The discountable items were flying off the shelves during the sale.
meanings.sent3: I found a discountable deal on a fancy watch that made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her negotiation skills were so discountable, she could talk anyone into a lower price.
meanings.sent5: The discountable offer was too good to pass up.

meanings.definition: Able to be taken into consideration or given less weight.
meanings.sent1: His discountable opinion was not as influential as he thought.
meanings.sent2: The discountable factors were not as important in the final decision.
meanings.sent3: She had a discountable excuse for being late, but it was still funny.
meanings.sent4: The discountable arguments in the debate were quickly dismissed.
meanings.sent5: The discountable details were easily overlooked in the grand scheme of things.
